Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right Jim. Your quarterlies look very good. How are things at the library?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I told you. I couldn't close it. So...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you've come to the master for guidance? Is this what you're saying, grasshopper?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually, you called me in here, but yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Well, let me show you how it's done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Yes, I'd like to speak to your office manager, please. Yes, hello. This is Michael Scott. I am the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Paper Products. Just wanted to talk to you manager-a-manger.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Done deal. Thank you very much, sir. You're a gentleman and a scholar. Oh, I'm sorry. OK. I'm sorry. My mistake. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was a woman I was talking to, so... She had a very low voice. Probably a smoker, so... [Clears throat] So that's the way it's done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've, uh, I've been at Dunder Mifflin for 12 years, the last four as Regional Manager. If you want to come through here... See we have the entire floor. So this is my kingdom, as far as the eye can see. This is our receptionist, Pam. Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam Beesly. Pam has been with us for... forever. Right, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you think she's cute now, you should have seen her a couple of years ago. [growls]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Any messages?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah. Just a fax.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Pam, this is from Corporate. How many times have I told you? There's a special filing cabinet for things from corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You haven't told me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's called the wastepaper basket! Look at that! Look at that face.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: People say I am the best boss. They go, "God we've never worked in a place like this before. You're hilarious." "And you get the best out of us." [shows the camera his WORLD'S BEST BOSS mug] I think that pretty much sums it up. I found it at Spencer Gifts.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] Shall I play for you? Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming] I have no gifts for you. Pa rum pump um pum [Imitates heavy drumming]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: My job is to speak to clients on the phone about... uh, quantities and type of copier paper. You know, whether we can supply it to them. Whether they can pay for it. And... I'm boring myself just talking about this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whassup!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whassup! I still love that after seven years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whassup!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whassup!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whass...up!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whassup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Strains, grunts] What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. All right. See you later.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Take care.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on her cell phone] Just before lunch. That would be great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Corporate really doesn't really interfere with me at all. Jan Levinson Gould. [walking out of his office] Jan, hello. I call her Hillary Rodham Clinton. Right? Not to her face, because... well, not because I'm scared of her. Because I'm not. But, um... Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Alright, was there anything you wanted to add to the agenda?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... Me no get an agenda.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What? I'm sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't get any agenda.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I faxed one over to you this morning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? I didn't... [looks at Pam] Did we get a fax this morning?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah, the one...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why isn't it in my hand? A company runs on efficiency of communication, right? So what's the problem, Pam? Why didn't I get it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You put in the garbage can that was a special filing cabinet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, that was a joke. That was a joke that was actually my brother's, and... It was supposed to be with bills and it doesn't work great with faxes.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Do you want to look at mine?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah. Lovely. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK. Since the last meeting, Ellen and the board have decided we can't justify a Scranton branch and a Stamford branch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael, don't panic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, this is good. This is good. This is fine. Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, no, no, Michael, listen OK. Don't panic. We haven't made... We haven't decided.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All the alarm bells are kind of going... ringie-dingie-ding!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I've spoken to Josh in Stamford. I've told him the same as you and it's up to either him or you to convince me that your branch can incorporate the other.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. No problem.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: This does, however, mean that there is going to be downsizing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Me no wanna hear that, Jan. Because downsizing is a bitch. It is a real bitch. And I wouldn't wish that on Josh's men. I certainly wouldn't wish it on my men. Or women, present company excluded. Sorry. Uh, is Josh concerned about downsizing himself? Not downsizing himself but is he concerned about downsizing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Question. How long do we have to... [Telephone rings] Oh uh, Todd Packer, terrific rep. Do you mind if I take it?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Packman.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hey, you big queen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, that's not appropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hey, is old Godzillary coming in today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, I don't know what you mean.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: I've been meaning to ask her one question. Does the carpet match the drapes?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God! Oh! That's... horrifying. Horrible. Horrible person.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So do you think we could keep a lid on this for now? I don't want to worry people unnecessarily.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, absolutely. Under this regime, it will not leave this office. [zips his lips] Like that.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: So what does downsizing actually mean?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You guys better update your resumes just like I'm doing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I bet it's gonna be me. Probably gonna be me.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, it'll be you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have an important question for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you going to Angela's cat party on Sunday?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, stop. That is ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Am I going to tell them? No, I am not going to tell them. I don't see the point of that. As a doctor, you would not tell a patient if they had cancer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is Mr. Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guilty! Guilty as charged!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ryan Howard from the temp agency. Daniqua sent me down to start today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Howard, like Moe Howard. Three Stooges.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Watch this. This is Moe. Nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck-nyuck. Mee! [hold hand up for a high five] Ah, right here. Three Stooges. Oh, Pam. It's a guy thing, Pam. I'm sort of a student of comedy. Watch this. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I'm Hitler. Adolf Hitler. [Continues with cod German]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think it would be the worst thing if they let me go because then I might... I don't think it's many little girls' dream to be a receptionist. I like to do illustrations. Um... Mostly watercolor. A few oil pencil. Um, Jim thinks they're good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure. Mr. Davis, let me call you right back. Yeah, something just came up. Two minutes. Thank you very much. Dwight, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just clearing my desk. I can't concentrate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not on your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's overlapping. It's all spilling over the edge. One word, two syllables. Demarcation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You can't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why not?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Safety violation. I could fall and pierce an organ.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [crosses fingers] We'll see. [Dwight begins smashing pencils with his phone] This is why the whole downsizing thing just doesn't bother me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Downsizing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Downsizing? I have no problem with that. I have been recommending downsizing since I first got here. I even brought it up in my interview. I say, bring it on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You just still have these messages from yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Relax. Everything's under control. Uh, yeah. Yeah. That's important. Right. Oh this is so important, I should run to answer it. [Imitating Six-Million Dollar Man sound effect]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on. Six-Million Dollar Man! Steve Austin! Actually, that would be a good salary for me, don't you think? Six million dollars? Memo to Jan. I deserve a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't we all?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you're unhappy with your compensation, maybe you should take it up with HR. OK. Not today, OK? Pam, just be professional. [Sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think I'm a role model here. I think I garner people's respect. [Imitating a PA] Attention all Dunder Mifflin employees, please. We have a meeting in the conference room, ASAP.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: People I respect, heroes of mine, would be Bob Hope... Abraham Lincoln, definitely. Bono. And probably God would be the fourth one. And I just think all those people really helped the world in so many ways that it's really beyond words. It's really incalculable.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now I know there's some rumors out there and I just kind of want to set the record straight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm Assistant Regional Manager. I should know first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Assistant to the Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, um, can you just tell me please? Just tell me quietly. Can you whisper it in my ear?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm about to tell everybody. I'm just about to tell everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can't you just tell us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please, OK? Do you want me to tell 'em?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't know what it is. [Laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK. You tell 'em. With my permission. Permission granted.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't need your permission.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Corporate has deemed it appropriate to enforce an ultimatum upon me. And Jan is thinking about downsizing either the Stamford branch or this branch.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I heard they might be closing this branch down. That's just the rumor going around. This is my first day. I don't really know.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah but Michael, what if they downsize here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not gonna happen.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It could be out of your hands Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It won't be out of my hands Stanley, OK. I promise you that.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Can you promise that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: On his mother's grave.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, yeah, it is a promise. And frankly, I'm a little insulted that you have to keep asking about it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's just that we need to know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. Hold on a second. I think Pam wanted to say something. Pam, you had a look that you wanted to ask a question just then.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was in the meeting with Jan and she did say that it could be this branch that gets the axe.

Quote.Speaker: Man
Quote.Text: Are you sure about that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, Pam maybe you should stick to the ongoing confidentiality agreement of meetings.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam, information is power.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You can't say for sure whether it'll be us or them, can you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Stanley. No, you did not see me in there with her. I said if Corporate wants to come in here and interfere, then they're gonna have to go through me. Right? You can go mess with Josh's people, but I'm the head of this family, and you ain't gonna be messing with my chillin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If I left, what would I do with all this useless information in my head? You know? Tonnage price of manila folders? Um, Pam's favorite flavor of yogurt, which is mixed berry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim said mixed berries? Well, yeah, he's on to me. Um... [Laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Watch out for this guy. Dwight Schrute in the building. This is Ryan, the new temp.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's up? Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Introduce yourself. Be polite.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute, Assistant Regional Manager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Assistant to the Regional Manager. So, uh, Dwight tell him about the kung fu and the car and everything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh... yeah I got a '78 280Z. Bought it for $1,200. Fixed it up. It's now worth three grand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's his profit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: New engine, new suspension, I got a respray. I've got some photos.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it! Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. Hold on, hold on. The judge is in session. What is the problem here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He put my stuff in Jell-O again.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's real professional thanks. That's the third time and it wasn't funny the first two times either Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's OK here, but people sometimes take advantage because it's so relaxed. I'm a volunteer Sheriff's Deputy on the weekends. And you cannot screw around there. That's sort of one of the rules.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is my stapler.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Do not take it out. You have to eat it out of there, because there are starving people in the world [turns to camera] which I hate, and it is a waste of that kind of food.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK you know what, you can be a witness. [points to Ryan] Can you reprimand him?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How do you know it was me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's always you. Are you going to discipline him or not?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Discipline. Kinky! [Laughs] All right, here's the deal you guys. The thing about a practical joke is you have to know when to start and as well as when to stop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And yeah, Jim this is the time to stop putting Dwight's personal effects into Jell-O.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. Dwight, I'm sorry, because I have always been your biggest flan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Laughing] Nice. That's the way it is around here. It just kind of goes round and round.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You should've put him in custardy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Yes! New guy! He scores.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, that's great. I guess what I'm most concerned with is damage to company property. That's all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pudding. Pudding... I'm trying to think of another dessert to do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you like going out at the end of the week for a drink?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's why we're all going out. So we can have an end-of-the-week-drink.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So when are we going out?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tonight, hopefully.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey, baby.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy's my fiance. We've been engaged about three years. We were supposed to get married in September but I think we're gonna get married in the spring.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you mind if I go out for a drink with these guys?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: No, no. Come on. Let's get out of here and go home.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK. I'm gonna be a few minutes. So it's only twenty past five. I still have to do my faxes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? You should come with us. Because you know we're all going out and it could be a good chance for you to see what people are like outside the office. I think it could be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: It sounds good. Seriously, we've gotta get going.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Um... What's in the bag?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Just tell her I'll talk to her later.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, definitely. All right, dude. Awesome. Will do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do I think I'll be invited to the wedding? [scratches head]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So have you felt the vibe yet? We work hard, we play hard. Sometimes we play hard when we should be working hard. Right? I guess the atmosphere that I've created here is that I'm a friend first, and a boss second... and probably an entertainer third. [Knock at door] Just a second. Right? Oh, hey do you like The Jamie Kennedy Experiment? Punk'd and all that kind of stuff?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are gonna be my accomplice. Just go along with it, OK?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just follow my lead. Don't pimp me, all right? Come in. So, uh, Corporate just said that I don't want to...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You got a fax.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you. Pam, can you come in here for a sec. Just have a seat. I was gonna call you in anyway. You know Ryan. As you know, there is going to be downsizing. And you have made my life so much easier in that I am going to have to let you go first.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why? Well, theft and stealing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stealing? What am I supposed to have stolen?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Post-it Notes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Post-it Notes? What are those worth, 50 cents?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: 50 cents, yeah. If you steal a thousand Post-It Notes at 50 cents apiece, and you know, you've made a profit... margin. You're gonna run us out of business, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. I am.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can't believe this. I mean I have never even stolen as much as a paperclip and you're firing me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But the best thing about it is that we're not going to have to give you any severance pay. Because that is gross misconduct and... Just clean out your desk. I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Pam starts crying] You been X'd punk! [Laughing] Surprise! It's a joke. We were joking around. See? OK. He was in on it. He was my accomplice. And it was kind of a morale booster thing. And we were showing the new guy around, giving him the feel of the place. So you... God, we totally got you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You're a jerk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know about that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is the most important thing for a company? Is it the cash flow? Is it the inventory? Nuh-uh. It's the people. The people. My proudest moment here was not when I increased profits by 17% or when I cut expenses without losing a single employee. No, no, no, no, no. It was a young Guatemalan guy. First job in the country, barely spoke English. He came to me, and said, "Mr. Scott, would you be the godfather of my child?" Wow. Wow. Didn't work out in the end. We had to let him go. He sucked.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How are things?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good. I thought you were going out for a drink with...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no, I just decided not to. How's your headache?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's better, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's great

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... Are you...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Am I walking out?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, I... Do you want to...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. Let me just...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Car horn honking] Oh, Roy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Listen, have a nice weekend.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, definitely. You too. Enjoy it. [looks at camera] You know what, just come here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute. My father's name, also Dwight Schrute. My grandfather's name, Dweide Schrude, Amish. That's my family. I don't know where they came, the Amish, came from originally. Uh, Amland.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding up a Dundie and pretending it is talking] Hello. I'm Michael Scott. I'm the best boss in the world.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: My name is Jim Halpert and I am a sales rep, which is a very important job. Um, without me dozens literally dozens of small businesses would go paperless. They would have to write on their hands, or bed sheets, or who knows you know. Total chaos, total chaos. I mean or they could get their paper somewhere else. Staples maybe. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam! Pam-Pam! Pam has been with us for... forever. Right, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, at one time or another every guy in the office has sprayed on Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Messages?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: People respond to the human touch and that's what I give them. I can look at a client and I can say, "Hello, how are you? How's business been going?" And we can go back and forth for sometime and uh, then I'll say, How much, how many reams do you want?" And they'll order it and then I'll take care of all the sales. I'll make sure that they get that paper. And they appreciate that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, right here. Three Stooges. High five. [Michael and Ryan high five] Oh, Pam. It's a guy thing, Pam. [camera cuts to Pam then back to Michael] Now, who was the one before Curly?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, Shemp.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Curly? Very good. Curly Joe DeRita.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Just Curly. Joe DeRita was different.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, comedy's kinda my thing. Watch this, here's Curly Joe. Mmm. Me, me, me, me, me, me. Me, me, me, me, me, me. Oh, I forgot. Here we go. [Yelling in cod German] I'm Hitler. Right. [Continues with cod German] Me, me, me, me, me, me. Curly Joe Hitler. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All these people are walking around and they're happy and their lives are just going along, ignorance is bliss. But if they knew what was lurking on the other side of that fence that furry monster. [imitating monster] "I'm gonna get you, downsizing." No. They wouldn't... They'd freak. And I'm not going to play God. They look to me for support. And they look to me for guidance and leadership. And I think if I could lie to them and it serves them, then that's what I'm going to do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So this is our sales staff. They are the ones who are making calls and making us lots of money. [comes to a screeching halt and laughs] This is accounting. The numbers dudes. Do not let the job description fool you, they are all completely crazy. Especially that guy, he is a mental patient. [camera zooms in on Kevin] Not literally of course, that wouldn't work. The last place you'd want somebody like that is accounting. [hides behind office plant] "Very interesting, but stupid." Artie Johnson. It's a crazy place.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My name is Angela and um, I'm in charge of the accounting department. There are three of us, Kevin and Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's my job to keep the books in order. And, um, I... I'm, uh, immediately below my supervisor.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar, how do I describe him. He's like a stapler. Do I need a stapler? Yes. But, I'm still the one that has to push it down.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: There's a lot of anxiety. I don't want to get laid off. This place is like five minutes from my house.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't wanna be laid off. This is a good job for me. 'Cause I need my nights free. I'm in a band.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Not very worried about downsizing right now. Because, uh, I think you've met Kevin and um...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can I just say one thing? Um, my friend is Jewish, Art Geller. And a couple of years ago he, um, showed me how you can plant a tree in Israel, so I planted a tree. So... You know 'cause... Yeah we work in paper. Well, you know, I try to give back.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have a lot of cat figurines on my desk. I think cats, really, are old souls. And, uh, Phyllis thinks so too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What you don't know... Well, it can hurt you, but if you don't know it won't hurt you. Then, you can just be happy for a little while at least.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wired.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, John Belushi. What a crazy guy. Phew, freaked myself out this morning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. I thought I found a lump. I checked the, uh... I check the jewels every month. This time... You know, it's a little different. It was fine. It was fine. But freaky, man, you know. Testicular cancer, God. Cancer, whoa testicles. So... What's, um... What you eating?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Smoked turkey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, place around the corner. Nice. All right. See you later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I need to speak up? [grabs boom microphone] Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Documentary Crew Member
Quote.Text: [boom microphone drops into the camera shoot] Can you move it out? Can you move it? Is that all right? Can you make that work?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Documentary Crew Member
Quote.Text: [new take] No, you don't even need ... That's fine. We'll keep it...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry it makes me nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Documentary Crew Member
Quote.Text: Understood, but it is what we need to capture what you're saying as clearly as possible.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I understand. It's in a blind spot because I'm trained in several martial arts and one of them, uh, includes, uh, an awareness that the masters bring, uh, of anything on all sides of you. It could be behind you or whatever. This is directly in a blind spot, so I'm trained to respond negatively to something right above my head. [new take] This now I have an eye on. You see, it's on my periphery and if I needed to block it, attack it, stop it somehow. [does a martial arts move with his hands] I could come right out. I mean, I know you're doing your job, but...

Quote.Speaker: Documentary Crew Member
Quote.Text: [talking over Dwight] It's...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm doing my job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think better to be a happy idiot then a, um... Then someone who knows the truth.
